meanings.definition: To commit a violation in a game or sport.
meanings.sent1: He fouls by pushing the opponent.
meanings.sent2: She always fouls when she's losing.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy player fouls every time he tries to steal the ball.
meanings.sent4: His aggressive play style often fouls his chances of winning.
meanings.sent5: The referee blew the whistle as soon as he fouled.

meanings.definition: An act of committing a violation in a game or sport.
meanings.sent1: The coach pointed out the fouls made by the team.
meanings.sent2: The referee called a foul on the player for tripping.
meanings.sent3: The fans booed loudly at the unfair foul called by the referee.
meanings.sent4: The foul in the final minute changed the outcome of the game.
meanings.sent5: She received a warning for her repeated fouls during the match.
